intro: Oxytropis ribumoo, commonly known as the alpine milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly found in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are typically compound, with small leaflets arranged in a feather-like pattern. Oxytropis ribumoo is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
